title: How to Cook Steak Without a Grill

steps.headline: Prep the steak.
steps.description: To begin prepping your steak, you first want to wash your hands. Lay the steaks on a cutting board or any type of surface that can be easily disinfected. Measure out the salt, pepper, and garlic powder. As you measure out each seasoning, place it into a dish. Stir them with a fork to make sure that they are evenly mixed. Use your fingers to grasp a dash of the mixture and sprinkle enough of the seasoning on the top of the steak so that it is adequately covered. Turn the steak over and repeat this with the other side.

steps.headline: Place the cup of steak marinade into the Ziploc bag.
steps.description: Put the steaks into the Ziploc bag with the marinade. Push all of the excess air out of the bag and zip it shut. Shake the bag several times as to thoroughly coat the steaks with marinade. You can now place the entire bag with all of its contents into the refrigerator. Refrigerate the bag for 24 hours.

steps.headline: Preheat your oven to 400 °F (204 °C).
steps.description: While the oven is preheating, turn your stove on high and heat your cast iron pan. To heat your cast iron pan, measure out 1/4 cup of peanut oil and pour it into the pan. Heat the pan for five minutes on the stove.

steps.headline: Place the steaks into the cast iron.
steps.description: Use your tongs to turn the steaks after 45 seconds in order to properly sear each side of the steaks.

steps.headline: Place the cast iron pan and entire contents into the oven.
steps.description: Allow the steaks to cook for three and a half minutes on one side and then remove the pan from the oven. Use your tongs to flip the steaks and place the pan back into the oven for another three and a half minutes.

steps.headline: Open the oven and remove the pan of steaks.
steps.description: Place the steaks on a plate so that they can rest for ten minutes prior to serving. Otherwise, if left in the pan, the steaks will continue cooking and become overcooked.

steps.headline: Place the steaks on a plate to be served with a sharp knife and fork.
steps.description: Enjoy! This recipe is a definite way to get a delicious steak without the need for a grill.

text: Prep the steak. To begin prepping your steak, you first want to wash your hands. Lay the steaks on a cutting board or any type of surface that can be easily disinfected. Measure out the salt, pepper, and garlic powder. As you measure out each seasoning, place it into a dish. Stir them with a fork to make sure that they are evenly mixed. Use your fingers to grasp a dash of the mixture and sprinkle enough of the seasoning on the top of the steak so that it is adequately covered. Turn the steak over and repeat this with the other side. Place the cup of steak marinade into the Ziploc bag. Put the steaks into the Ziploc bag with the marinade. Push all of the excess air out of the bag and zip it shut. Shake the bag several times as to thoroughly coat the steaks with marinade. You can now place the entire bag with all of its contents into the refrigerator. Refrigerate the bag for 24 hours. Preheat your oven to 400 °F (204 °C). While the oven is preheating, turn your stove on high and heat your cast iron pan. To heat your cast iron pan, measure out 1/4 cup of peanut oil and pour it into the pan. Heat the pan for five minutes on the stove. Place the steaks into the cast iron. Use your tongs to turn the steaks after 45 seconds in order to properly sear each side of the steaks. Place the cast iron pan and entire contents into the oven. Allow the steaks to cook for three and a half minutes on one side and then remove the pan from the oven. Use your tongs to flip the steaks and place the pan back into the oven for another three and a half minutes. Open the oven and remove the pan of steaks. Place the steaks on a plate so that they can rest for ten minutes prior to serving. Otherwise, if left in the pan, the steaks will continue cooking and become overcooked. Place the steaks on a plate to be served with a sharp knife and fork. Enjoy! This recipe is a definite way to get a delicious steak without the need for a grill.
